name: Scarabeus Virgata
description:
--Fig07--
Scarabeus Virgata is an Echinoderm Testudine creature from Mastika, an exoplanet located 2000 light years away from Earth, orbiting the star Gumala.
Scarabeus lives in gigantic deserts, some of them as big as Earth, in which droughts can last for thousands of years. It is a huge species, it may reach an astounding 12 meters in height. The individuals have a very thick skin, able to easily survive in harsh sandstorms.
Scarabeus has constant connection with other parts of its spirit, those who are mostly creatures living in dense oceans on different galaxies, so it dreams of swimming, while it helps to keep the wind flow in its own planet.
